Vocabularies.Definition: n., v. help 帮助，援助
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He went to the aid of the hurt man.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  hit or knock (sth.) with a dull-sounding blow  砰地碰撞
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I bumped into a tree in the dark.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.	put (thoughts, etc.) out of one's mind; remove (sb.) from a position 摒除，排除；解除…的职务
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Peter was dismissed form his post.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. (cause to) become less tense	（使）减轻
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I gave him some medicine to ease the pain.

Vocabularies.Definition: not give up; not let go of 不放弃；抓住
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He was imprisoned for 19 years and yet held on to his belief.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. causing a feeling of extreme fear or dislike  	恐怖的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Kathy fainted when she saw the horrible sight.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. not patient 不耐烦的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He is too impatient with his kids.

Vocabularies.Definition: 健康状况良好（很好，差）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   All the kids are in good health.

Vocabularies.Definition: 尽管
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   In spite of all his efforts, the boy did not recover.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. （使）倾向于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Mr. Brown inclines towards conservatism.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. place, fix (a piece of equipment) in position for use  安装，安置
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I will definitely have a gas heater installed in my house before this winter.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 间隔
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Trees will be planted on both sides of the street at intervals of 10 meters.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 令人痛苦的；悲惨的，不幸的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He lived a miserable life when he was young.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 乐观的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He was optimistic about the future of mankind.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. force a way (into or through sth.); be fully understood穿透，刺入；被充分领悟
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Our eyes could not penetrate the darkness.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. advancing gradually by stages over a period of time 进行性的；循序渐进的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   One prominent symptom of the disease is the progressive loss of memory.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. weakness that a person or thing has 缺点，短处
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Despite all his shortcomings, he makes a good friend.

Vocabularies.Definition: 患…病；苦于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She sometimes suffers from a stomachache.

Vocabularies.Definition: to a certain extent , partly 一定程度上，部分地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   These statements are, to a degree, all correct.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 个性，特点
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The color of one's eyes is a genetic trait.
